title: Star Wars actor Joel Edgerton basically confirms return for Ewan McGregor’s Obi Wan Kenobi series
text:
Ewan McGregor’s Obi Wan Kenobi series may have added another Star Wars favourite (Picture: Lucasfilm/METRO)

Ewan McGregor’s Star Wars TV series is beginning to shape up nicely as it appears the Disney epic has recruited another key player from the prequels (Episodes, one, two and three) in Joel Edgerton, who all but confirmed his addition to the cast.

Earlier this year it was announced McGregor would be slipping into Obi Wan Kenobi’s robes once again to star in a series following the legendary Jedi Master, originally played by Alec Guinness.

Naturally, then, more characters from the first three episodes of Star Wars will likely be popping up and, like you, we’re praying to the force Jar Jar Binks won’t be returning in any form and is kept at a safe distance in a galaxy far, far away.

Edgerton made a brief cameo as Luke Skywalker’s uncle Owen Lars in 2006’s Revenge of the Sith before he became the Hollywood juggernaut he is today. And appearing on the Happy Sad Confused podcast with Josh Horowitz, the 45-year-old came agonisingly close to spilling some Star Wars infused tea.

‘There is a very real possibility [I’ll be appearing],’ Edgerton revealed, before making sure he didn’t say anything else to give the game away. ‘There’s potentially an assassin on a rooftop just outside the window if I say the wrong thing. I’d love to say all sorts of things. I’m just not going to.’

Thankfully, McGregor has been a little more forthcoming and made a surprise appearance at the Disney D23 Expo back in August where he was introduced by Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy.

Joel Edgerton remained suspiciously coy over the Star Wars prequel (Picture: REUTERS)

She began: ‘Before leaving, we do have one more announcement.

‘After secrets, and fibs, and not being able to talk about it, I am thrilled to bring out a beloved member of the Star Wars family.’

McGregor then charged on stage and turned to the exec. ‘Kathleen, can you ask me in front of all of these people, all of these witnesses, can you please ask me, am I going to play Obi-Wan Kenobi again?’

I’m coming back! Ewan tells the D23 expo. (Picture: Getty)

She grinned: ‘Ewan, are you going to play Obi-Wan Kenobi again?’

The Scottish star then looked out into the audience and confirmed: ‘Yes.’

The Obi Wan Kenobi prequel is expected to arrive on Disney in either 2020 or 2021.
